column2: Assisting in the preparation and management of commercial contracts, including reviewing and negotiating terms and conditions.             Helping to develop pricing strategies, analyzing market trends, and evaluating the competition to ensure the company remains competitive.             Assisting with the development and implementation of sales and marketing plans, including conducting market research and identifying potential new business opportunities. Participating in contract negotiations with customers, suppliers, and other business partners.             Developing and maintaining relationships with customers and other stakeholders to ensure customer satisfaction and business growth.             Managing commercial risks, such as credit and pricing risks, and implementing appropriate risk management strategies.             Assisting with the preparation of commercial reports and presentations for senior management and other stakeholders.               About you           You have a degree qualification in civil engineering and be a member of a professional body. You have experience for a project of similar nature.

column2: EA Finance to CEO  Mumbai, India We are DNEG, one of the world's leading visual effects and animation companies for feature film and television, with worldwide offices and studios across North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. We are currently seeking a dynamic and results-driven professional to assume the pivotal role of Finance Executive Assistant within our CEO's office. This position entails a wide array of responsibilities, including: Spearheading      the preparation and meticulous management of financial reports. Engaging      in meticulous budget planning to optimize financial resources effectively. Conducting      comprehensive financial planning and analytics to inform strategic      decision-making processes. Offering      invaluable insights to guide strategic initiatives and pivotal      decision-making steps. Providing      strategic input on financial matters to drive sustainable growth and      profitability. Acting      as a liaison and adeptly managing relationships with diverse stakeholders,      both domestically and internationally, spanning our offices in India and      beyond. Vigilantly      overseeing compliance efforts and remaining abreast of industry regulatory      changes to ensure adherence to best practices and legal requirements. Qualifications and Skills:  Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or related field preferred.  Proven experience of 7-10 years in administrative support roles, preferably in a finance or accounting environment.  Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and financial software applications.  Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact professionally at all levels of the organization.  Discretion and integrity when handling confidential information.  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.
column11: Strategic Financial Planning, Financial Management, Budgetary Control, Business Planning

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic and analytical Corporate Strategy Associate with 2-3 years of experience in a similar field to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic direction of our organization, conducting in-depth market analysis, and supporting the development and execution of corporate strategies. This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with senior leadership and make a tangible impact on the company's growth and success. Key Responsibilities: Evaluate      market trends, value chain, competition, business and operational models,      customer segments, regulations, channel strategies, identify opportunities      for market entry, market expansion and growth operational improvement,      including resolving integration issues and synergy assessment, headcount      and facilities optimization etc Work      with client engagement teams executing organization projects which support      key decision makers in developing and executing strategies for business Be      responsible for understanding the client's growth vision, business model,      resources, strategy and planning, and risks Evaluate      clients business model, value chain, competition, operating model, cost      structure and identify opportunities for sustainable cost reduction,      zero-basing capabilities, headcount and footprint optimization, and      process excellence Effectively      participate with teams with diverse skills and backgrounds, while staying      abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's      business The      candidate may be required to lead and support multiple projects      simultaneously, as required, while ensuring quality and timely      deliverables; Conduct      comprehensive market research and competitive analysis to identify      industry trends, market opportunities, and threats. Analyze      data from various sources to provide insights into market conditions,      customer needs, and competitive positioning. Assist      in the formulation, development, and execution of corporate strategies and      business plans. Collaborate      with cross-functional teams to gather information, analyze data, and      develop strategic recommendations. Support      the preparation of strategic presentations and reports for senior      management and stakeholders. Track      and evaluate the performance of strategic initiatives and projects. Develop      and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators      (KPIs) and strategic goals. Manage      and coordinate strategic projects, ensuring they are completed on time and      within scope. Facilitate      meetings and workshops to drive alignment and decision-making among      stakeholders. Perform      financial modeling and analysis to support strategic decisions and      business case development. Evaluate      potential mergers, acquisitions, partnerships, and other growth      opportunities. Education: Masterss      degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field.      A masters degree or MBA is a plus. Experience: 2-3      years of experience in corporate strategy, management consulting,      investment banking, or a related field. Skills : Strong      analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret      complex data and provide actionable insights. Excellent      communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex      information clearly and concisely. Proficiency      in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word); experience with data      analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Tableau) is a plus. Strong      project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects      simultaneously.
